intro: Tetratheca glandulosa var. pilosa, commonly known as the woolly tetratheca, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its hairy or glandular foliage, which gives it its varietal name "pilosa." The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It is a member of the family Theaceae, which includes other flowering plants with similar morphological features. This species is often found in rocky or sandy soils in arid and semi-arid regions.
